title: Workshop on Identifying and Critically Interpreting Data Visualization Misinformation

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental data interpretation skills and understanding of basic graph types (bar/line/pie)
context.additional_context: Structured around frequent visual error cases encountered by practicing elementary educators when making data-driven decisions in science fields

learning_goals: Learners can accurately identify distortion elements in over 80% of 14 types of misinformation visualization cases.
Learners identify axis manipulation cases (inverted y-axis, irregular x-axis intervals, dual axes) with 100% accuracy in three consecutive evaluations.
Learners can reconstruct incorrect conclusions derived from misinformation visualizations into three or more alternative interpretations using data literacy.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
